### Ponyshoe prior

A simple, one-variable Bayesian linear regression model using an ponyshoe prior.

```{r linear_ponyshoe_greta}
ponyshoe <- function (tau = 1, eta = 3, s = 1, dim = NULL) {
  tau2    <- tau ^ 2
  c2      <- inverse_gamma(alpha = eta / 2, beta = eta * s ^ 2)
  lambda  <- cauchy(0, 1, truncation = c(0, Inf), dim = dim)
  lambda2 <- lambda ^ 2
  lambda_tilde <- (c2 * lambda2) / (c2 * tau2 * lambda2)
  sd <- tau2 * lambda_tilde ^ 2
  
  normal(zeros_like(sd), sd, dim = dim)
}

# variables & priors
int  <- variable()
sd   <- inverse_gamma(1, 1)
coef <- ponyshoe()

# linear predictor
mu <- int + coef * attitude$complaints

# observation model
distribution(attitude$rating) <- normal(mu, sd)
```
